normal_relationships: Children (<16) and retirees (>65) typically show wage per hour = 0, weeks worked in year = 0, and zero capital gains. Adults with very high wages (>500) normally report full-year employment (52 weeks) and often self-employment. Positive capital gains generally occur with non-zero weeks worked and a tax filer status other than 4 (non-filer).

anomaly_conditions.condition: wage per hour > 500 AND weeks worked in year = 0
anomaly_conditions.explanation: A lucrative hourly wage without any recorded weeks worked conflicts with normal earning patterns.
anomaly_conditions.scenario: Data entry error assigning executive-level pay to an individual who reported no employment.

anomaly_conditions.condition: age < 16 AND weeks worked in year > 0
anomaly_conditions.explanation: Minors are not expected to report significant annual employment duration.
anomaly_conditions.scenario: Illicit child labor or misrecorded age/working-weeks information.
